channel.title: Comments on: I hate iTunes/Airport Express part 1

item.title: By: bfp
item.dc:creator: bfp
item.description:
The router is setup to LAN one MAC address, Lazy WDS and WDS subnet are disabled.
The AX WDS is configured as a remote base station but I have disabled "Allow wireless connections...". So effectively I'm not really using the WDS ability as the laptops hook up to the wireless router as opposed to the AX. I'm in a wooden 1917 house so there isn't anything particularly blocking our signals.
(I've MacStumbled and executed Airport Client Monitor too - no named other networks or bad noise/weak signal at any time. Occasionally bandwidth drops a little).
As I understand it, WDS isn't really necessary but I can't get an alternative configuration to work.
My next plan of attack is to borrow another AX and swap out the Linksys and see if this eliminates a variable.
item.content:encoded:
The router is setup to LAN one MAC address, Lazy WDS and WDS subnet are disabled.

The AX WDS is configured as a remote base station but I have disabled “Allow wireless connections…”. So effectively I’m not really using the WDS ability as the laptops hook up to the wireless router as opposed to the AX. I’m in a wooden 1917 house so there isn’t anything particularly blocking our signals.

(I’ve MacStumbled and executed Airport Client Monitor too – no named other networks or bad noise/weak signal at any time. Occasionally bandwidth drops a little).

As I understand it, WDS isn’t really necessary but I can’t get an alternative configuration to work.

My next plan of attack is to borrow another AX and swap out the Linksys and see if this eliminates a variable.

item.title: By: jonathon
item.dc:creator: jonathon
item.description: How is your WDS setup ? I've seen a WDS setup that basically devoured itself by deciding to chain the relay nodes into a loop. I noticed it because of bad performance and lots of Airport Express dropouts. That said, it was an Apple-only setup and I didn't have the linksys element.
item.content:encoded:
How is your WDS setup ?
I’ve seen a WDS setup that basically devoured itself by deciding to chain the relay nodes into a loop. I noticed it because of bad performance and lots of Airport Express dropouts. That said, it was an Apple-only setup and I didn’t have the linksys element.
